text: Kore or is a moon of Jupiter. It was found by a team of astronomers from the University of Hawaii led by Scott S. Sheppard in 2003 and given the designation .IAUC 8116: Satellites of Jupiter and Saturn 2003 April 11 (discovery)MPEC 2003-G10: S/2003 J 14 2003 April 3 (discovery and ephemeris) Kore is about 2 kilometers in diameter, and orbits Jupiter at an average distance of 23,239,000 km in 723.720 days, at an inclination of 141° to the ecliptic (139° to Jupiter's equator), with an orbital eccentricity of 0.2462. It belongs, which is made up of non-spherical retrograde moon It was named after Kore, another name for the Greek goddess Persephone (from the Greek κόρη, "daughter [of Demeter]").IAUC 8826: Satellites of Jupiter and Saturn (subscription-only) 2007 April 5 (naming the moon) == References == Category:Jupiter's moons
title: Kore (moon)
